DataElement.preferredName: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index Q9 Past Month Problem Keeping Up Enough Enthusiasm To Get Things Done Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated perception of how often in the past month they had a problem keeping up enough enthusiasm to get things done, using a 4 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index Past Month Problem Enough Enthusiasm to Get Things Done Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval._Before the present time._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution._A question about how much of a problem it has been for an individual to keep up enough enthusiasm to get thing done._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval.

Concepts.definition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval.

Property.preferredName: Past Month Problem Enough Enthusiasm to Get Things Done Score

It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.:A question about how much of a problem it has been for an individual to keep up enough enthusiasm to get thing done.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

Concepts.longName: Enough Enthusiasm to Get Things Done
Concepts.definition: A question about how much of a problem it has been for an individual to keep up enough enthusiasm to get thing done.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: PSQI Problem Score 4 Point Likert Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard for the subjective scoring of how much something is a problem that ranges from 0: Not at all to 3: A very big problem.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that something is a minor difficulty requiring resolution.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that something is a minor difficulty requiring resolution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that something is a difficulty requiring resolution.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that something is a difficulty requiring resolution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that something is a major difficulty requiring resolution.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that something is a major difficulty requiring resolution.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring and Interpretation Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are available on the University of Pittsburg, Sleep Medicine Institute website.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.description: During the past month, how much of a problem has it been for you to keep up enough enthusiasm to get things done?
